pr_title: [NETBEANS-4339] PHP Mess Detector - added option to use custom rules

timeline.author: junichi11

timeline.message: [NETBEANS-4339] PHP Mess Detector - added option to use custom rule set file

timeline.bodyText: You could/should set not to use FQN (it should be somewhere in the IDE Options, Java GUI editor). Then, the patch would be a bit more readable. Thanks.
timeline.author: tmysik

replies.bodyText: I changed the setting (had no idea it exists) and fixed the file.
replies.author: KacerCZ

+package org.netbeans.modules.php.analysis;
+
+import java.util.List;
+import org.openide.filesystems.FileObject;
+
+public final class MessDetectorParams {
+
+    private List<String> ruleSets;
+    private FileObject ruleSetFile;
+
+    public List<String> getRuleSets() {
+        return ruleSets;

timeline.bodyText: Should use package private instead of public.
timeline.author: junichi11

timeline.bodyText: I would consider i18n because it is not a command or parameter.
timeline.author: junichi11
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -59,10 +60,12 @@
     private static final String REPORT_FORMAT_PARAM = "xml"; // NOI18N
     private static final String EXCLUDE_PARAM = "--exclude"; // NOI18N
     private static final String SUFFIXES_PARAM = "--suffixes"; // NOI18N
+    public static final String EMPTY_RULE_SET = "<none>"; // NOI18N

replies.bodyText:
It's kind of special rule - ignored during command parameters building, but still written into settings.
Making it translated would also mean to map value saved into settings to translated value shown in list, right?
replies.author: KacerCZ

replies.bodyText: I agree with Junichi, this should be translated. However, the stored value should be just some identificator (so, not the translated string).
replies.author: tmysik

replies.bodyText: Can you point me to a place in NetBeans where something like this is done or what class/interface to look for, please.
replies.author: KacerCZ

replies.bodyText: Not sure what you mean... Do you mean a custom Renderer for the given JList so this specific option can be translated?
replies.author: tmysik

replies.bodyText:
Yes, that are the keywords I was looking for ;)
I'm novice in Java/NetBeans realm and I try to learn it by observing how these things are done in other parts of the project.
replies.author: KacerCZ

replies.bodyText: This is more about Java and Swing than NetBeans. See the official UI tutorial. This tutorial is fine IMHO and I am pretty sure that you will be able to find a similar case already used in NetBeans ;)
replies.author: tmysik

replies.bodyText:
I created renderer based on PHPStanLevelListCellRenderer.
Value is now only dash '-' and '<none>' is shown in list.
Before testing again you should clean userdir.
replies.author: KacerCZ

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/php/php.code.analysis/src/org/netbeans/modules/php/analysis/commands/MessDetector.java b/php/php.code.analysis/src/org/netbeans/modules/php/analysis/commands/MessDetector.java
index 8989607d5c..8419b0d7cb 100644
--- a/php/php.code.analysis/src/org/netbeans/modules/php/analysis/commands/MessDetector.java
+++ b/php/php.code.analysis/src/org/netbeans/modules/php/analysis/commands/MessDetector.java

@@ -60,7 +60,7 @@ public final class MessDetector {
     private static final String REPORT_FORMAT_PARAM = "xml"; // NOI18N
     private static final String EXCLUDE_PARAM = "--exclude"; // NOI18N
     private static final String SUFFIXES_PARAM = "--suffixes"; // NOI18N
-    public static final String EMPTY_RULE_SET = "<none>"; // NOI18N
+    public static final String EMPTY_RULE_SET = "-"; // NOI18N
 
     // rule sets
     @org.netbeans.api.annotations.common.SuppressWarnings(value = "MS_MUTABLE_COLLECTION", justification = "It is immutable") // NOI18N
